meanings.definition: To utter a loud, harsh cry of disapproval or displeasure.
meanings.sent1: The audience booed loudly when the actor forgot his lines.
meanings.sent2: The fans booed the referee's decision during the game.
meanings.sent3: The children booed playfully at the silly clown.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm booed angrily as it passed overhead.
meanings.sent5: The protesters booed vehemently at the politician's speech.

meanings.definition: To express contempt or disapproval by booing.
meanings.sent1: The crowd booed to show their disapproval of the singer's performance.
meanings.sent2: She booed loudly at the terrible movie ending.
meanings.sent3: The cat booed at the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a monster.
meanings.sent4: The wind booed through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The students booed in unison at the unfair test results.

meanings.definition: To shout 'boo' in order to show disapproval or contempt.
meanings.sent1: The kids booed playfully at their friend's silly joke.
meanings.sent2: He booed jokingly when his friend tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent3: The dog booed at the mailman, thinking he was an intruder.
meanings.sent4: The wind booed through the cracks in the old house.
meanings.sent5: The audience booed in jest at the magician's failed trick.
